page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content:
The block is bisected from N to S by the narrow valley of the River Calder. Almost in the centre is the pretty village of Calder Vale set in a wooded hollow, and dominated by the Lappet Mill which is still producing cloth.
The surrounding area is mainly farmland either for pasture , hay or silage, with small hill farms having cattle for milk or beef, and sheep.
Rounded hills rise gradually from S to N and end in bleak fell and moorland on the higher slopes.
To the NE is the private estate of Bleasdale Tower, surrounded by woodland, while to the SW rises Sullom Hill. The land dips gently to the SE and the valley of the River Brock.
